Sentencas: Hydrogen production via steam electrolysis may involve less electrical energy consumption than conventional low temperature water electrolysis, reflecting the improved thermodynamics and kinetics at elevated temperatures.
Titulo: Hydrogen production through steam electrolysis: Model-based steady state performance of a cathode-supported intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The present paper reports on the development of a one-dimensional dynamic model of a cathode-supported planar intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell (SOEC) stack.
Titulo: Hydrogen production through steam electrolysis: Model-based steady state performance of a cathode-supported intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The model, which consists of an electrochemical model, a mass balance, and four energy balances, is here employed to study the steady state behaviour of an SOEC stack at different current densities and temperatures.
Titulo: Hydrogen production through steam electrolysis: Model-based steady state performance of a cathode-supported intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The simulations found that activation overpotentials.
Titulo: Hydrogen production through steam electrolysis: Model-based steady state performance of a cathode-supported intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: provide the largest contributions to irreversible losses while concentration overpotentials remained negligible throughout the stack.
Titulo: Hydrogen production through steam electrolysis: Model-based steady state performance of a cathode-supported intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: For an average current density of 7000 A m(-2) and an inlet steam temperature of 1023 K, the predicted electrical energy consumption of the stack is around 3 kW h per normal in 3 of hydrogen, significantly smaller than those of low temperature stacks commercially available today.
Titulo: Hydrogen production through steam electrolysis: Model-based steady state performance of a cathode-supported intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: However, the dependence of the stack temperature distribution on the average current density calls for strict temperature control, especially during dynamic operation.
Titulo: Hydrogen production through steam electrolysis: Model-based steady state performance of a cathode-supported intermediate temperature solid oxide electrolysis cell
